website_summaries.verdict: Trustworthy brand, professional level quality, and reasonable price make this filter easily the top choice.
pros: The build quality is good enough that you won’t have to worry about leaks
Among aftermarket brands, this is one of the most trusted
Packaged well to prevent damage during the shipping process
cons: May not fit all vehicles with which it’s listed as compatible

customer_reviews.title: 2003 avalanche z71
customer_reviews.text: You will almost certainly not be able to get the drain bolt off. Loosen the pan and insert harbor freight brake bleed Venturi and suck out the fluid. Remove bolts for exhaust or the pan will not clear. If you can't get the bolts off, use a thin board to jack the transmission up slightly to allow clearance. Don't over tighten the pan bolts they can strip out.
customer_reviews.author: Malinda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: I used to rebuild automatic transmissions for a living. I've seen the results of "OE equivalent" transmission filters that really aren't. Some aftermarket filters from large name parts stores fail when the filter screen ruptures from cold transmission fluid and others don't have the ability to filter out the tiny particles that they are supposed to. GM uses a fiber mesh in this filter, much like a synthetic felt. It keeps ALL the trash out of the transmission valve body. Perfect fit and function, as it is a GM part. This part number contains the filter, pan gasket and filter seal. As usual, cheapest on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Wacky Wiccan

customer_reviews.title: OEM quality
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my 2006 GMC Yukon XL Denali. It fit like a glove, just like OEM. Installation is time consuming if it's your first time as I was, but everything fits as it should. Everyone does oil changes, but forget about their transmission. Change the fluid in there once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: wickedbusa

customer_reviews.title: works fine
customer_reviews.text: filter works fine. My recommendation though... maybe you should not try to pull out the transmission filter brass/rubber o-ring that is up in the transmission. I've heard people leave them in for many transmission services with no problem. I did a couple 4L60E transmissions and had a real hard time replacing the o-ring, scraping the valve body hole a little. I would probably leave the old o-ring in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Noah83c

customer_reviews.title: Exact Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Same filter as original removed...As others have stated forget trying to get the drain plug out...loosen the 2 bracket screws on the linkage so it can be moved enough to remove pan... I removed all but a few bolts lowering the pan enough to get a small CLEAR LINE (tranny fluid does not taste very good!) in the pan and siphoned off a couple quarts of oil before removing the pan...gasket was packaged flat as it should be....
customer_reviews.author: D Max

customer_reviews.title: Just a filter and cheap gasket
customer_reviews.text: Just a cheap paper gasket with this filter plus a new cheap ring seal for the filter got a decent rubber gasket for NAPA and installed it. Paper gaskets tear when removed and are a pain to clean off the pan. For AC Delco, and the price paid, this was a ripoff as the filter isn't anything special either. Would have been better off getting a set from NAPA locally with a better rubber filter gasket. Won't make this mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity

customer_reviews.title: Correct part for the 2009 GMC Envoy SLT Inline 6, 4x4.  Fits & functions well.
customer_reviews.text: This is the correct part for the 2009 GMC Envoy SLT, Inline 6, 4 x 4. Fits & functions well. The vehicle drives better after changing the Transmission Fluid and Filter. Messy and time consuming if a person doesn't have access to a Hydraulic Lift like the Auto Mechanic Shops have but, if you do it yourself, you can save $200 or more.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Good OEM replacement
customer_reviews.text: Exact filter as my OEM, filter was perfect fit. Packaged well, flat shrink wrapped to piece of cardboard. No problems in the two months since installation. Biggest pain was cleaning old gasket off of the pan. Take your time to clean it well, make sure pan edges aren't bent. No Leaks!
customer_reviews.author: Notobiker

customer_reviews.title: Exact replacement to OEM
customer_reviews.text: This matched the filter that came off all the way to the patent number listed on the case. There’s a trick to getting the old oil seal out before replacing it with a new one. Use a flathead screwdriver with hammer to tap at the bottom ring of seal where the oil seal can be seen circling inlet.. The seal will buckle then come out with pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Maxclass

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Gasket was a perfect fit. Material seemed good and heavy. Filter also fit fine. Seems like the same ACDelco part you would get from the dealership. You might as well not bother going to the dealership to get parts off their shelves since they never stock anything anymore anyway. They just order it the same way you do and add a big mark-up.
customer_reviews.author: S M

customer_reviews.title: THE RIGHT KIT
customer_reviews.text: If you have a 4L60 or 4L65E GM transmission, don't take a chance on an aftermarket oil filter. I have heard too many horror stories about shifting problems with those. This is the factory filter kit and the price is right, plus Amazon has unbeatable service.
customer_reviews.author: The Ford's

customer_reviews.title: OEM replacement
customer_reviews.text: Just like OEM and fit's like a charm. This is for the deep oil pan so know which transmission you have before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Rigo

customer_reviews.title: There were no problems with the filters and gaskets.  Perfect fit no issues
customer_reviews.text: This job requires tools and some expertise, if this is the first time you will be doing this I highly recommend you search for a couple of videos in You Tube before you decide if it’s for you. There were no problems with the filters and gaskets. Perfect fit no issues Job performed in a Tahoe 2002 Z71. Oil plug in the transmission pan is a known issue that most of the time is too tight from factory, and it becomes impossible to remove without damaging the head of it. To remove the oil pan, you will have to remove the steel bracket that supports the transmission link cable.
customer_reviews.author: Alex CK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, quality part and easy installation. Hardest part of install was getting old seal out, after that it was a snap. Just make sure you read what the filter fits. This is for a deep pan, not a shallow one, GM used both.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Fitzsimmons

customer_reviews.title: Great OEM Product!
customer_reviews.text: Why would you buy any other filter for your GM vehicle? Fits my 2005 GMC Sierra and 2001 GMC Yukon, both with 4L60E trannies.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Great deal & fit right in
customer_reviews.text: This was a great deal and the installation was very easy and relatively quick.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: OEM is best!
customer_reviews.text: It was time to change my Filter and ATF I always go with OEM rather than some cheap filter. Did the job on my 09 Silverado 4l60e
customer_reviews.author: David V

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Love original car parts and this is no exception. Quick tip, the basket does not need any silicon sealant or basket maker of any kind. Simply put some petroleum jelly or vaseline before installing and gasket will not move around as you screw it. I've done a couple of these and have never had any leak.
customer_reviews.author: J24

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This filter and gasket works with most 1999-2006 GM 1/2 ton trucks and suvs that use a 4l80e transmission. You do not need to replace the filter seal if it still provides a tight fit for the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Matt & Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Gasket is no good
customer_reviews.text: The transmission oil filter is of good quality but the pan gasket it came with is not. After installing it I had a leak so I had to take it apart again and install a new gasket. For the price I would expect a quality gasket to come with it. Would have preferred to buy the Wix filter and a quality gasket separately.
customer_reviews.author: Dez

customer_reviews.title: ACDelco Transmission Filter
customer_reviews.text: ACDelco products are always the best for GM vehicles. Always use the correct filter for your application. This filter sits against the bottom of the oil pan with a slight standoff to take advantage of the added cooling along that surface(technically called plate cooling) with the suction at the filter opening(yellow opening). Most effective.
customer_reviews.author: beebop

customer_reviews.title: OEM replacement
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Fit my 2006 gmc van like a charm. Only issue I had is that I needed to drop my exhaust to get my pan off. Some people say you can get your pan off without removing your exhaust, but not in my case..
customer_reviews.author: Harold Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Still had a leak through the side.
customer_reviews.text: The leak was smaller but we were able to identify the leak still coming from side of oil pan. Not sure if its the oil pan that is damaged or was not positioned correctly. Product felt great though.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J. Mata

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect. Little ring/seal was hard to removed but that's a design flaw not a product flaw.
customer_reviews.author: W. White

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit.
customer_reviews.text: Gm changed the design from the original style with a crimped metal and plastic to an all plastic construction design. The new design had "little feet" on the bottom which would not allow the pan to seat properly.
customer_reviews.author: richard richmond

customer_reviews.title: A good filter
customer_reviews.text: A good gm filter for 50k mile replacement. Also prefer lube-locker pan gaskets due to easy cleanup, re-usable gasket & no leaks. Added a 1 qt larger pan w/ drain. Easy to keep fluid fresh by draining the pan once a year for refills.
customer_reviews.author: billy benton

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality and also fits perfect on my 99 chevy express v8 1500 . Not cheap though but the quality is amazing. I will buy only this filter again for my van!
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Pack the box right amazon. Cheap o Jeff at it again.
customer_reviews.text: No qualms with the acdelco product just with packing you should put packing material in the box to keep the product from getting damaged cork gaskets break when packaging is compromised. Otherwise high quality product paper filter/plastic construction.
customer_reviews.author: Jared c.

customer_reviews.title: Packaged well
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 2008 Chevy Avalanche 4L60E deep pan. Arrived wrapped in plastic with the gasket flat! Very nice. Bent, folded or stretched gaskets are a pain. I'm not sure the name of the gasket material, but it's the dense papery gasket. I like this type of gasket because it seems to be easier to remove when replacing. No leaks with proper torque. Comes with filter, pan gasket and the seal.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT ACDELCO TRANSMISSION FLUID FILTER KIT!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this ACDelco Professional Automatic Transmission Fluid Filter Kit, for my 2007 Chevy Silverado 1500 (4.3L), and the installation went beautifully with it. I was very happy to install the same filter kit that was currently in my transmission.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for the original one
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid transmission pan, great replacement for my original one that didn’t have a drain plug. Fit without any issues, I did not use the copper gasket they supply you with, I purchased a nylon gasket instead.
customer_reviews.author: The music man

customer_reviews.title: fast
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for a 2004 GMC Sierra 1500 WorkTruck 4.3 6cyl (WT) W/Deep Pan AUTO TRANS, 4 Speed Trans, 4L60-E, Deep Pan, 2WD, 4 SPEED
customer_reviews.author: Bkon33

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. They both worked as intended. No leaks after a few weeks of driving in both of my vehicles. I prefer this gasket versus the cork style gasket that was on one of my transmission pans.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Brake

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that I can order quality auto parts ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the GM original equipment transmission filter and it fits perfectly in my 2008 2wd Isuzu Ascender. I like the fact that I can order quality auto parts through amazon and be reasonably assured that the product fits. I like to drop my transmission oil pan every 40,000 miles to replace the oil and filter. My SUV really runs good after that.
customer_reviews.author: Warrren

customer_reviews.title: Installed on my 2002 Tahoe 5. 3 4x4. ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my 2002 Tahoe 5.3 4x4. Watch some youtube videos for some hints on installing. Can't go wrong with ACDelco.
customer_reviews.author: I. M. Stern

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for a 2005 Trailblazer LS 2X4 with deep ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for a 2005 Trailblazer LS 2X4 with deep sump transmission pan. Installed in about an hour total to include smoke breaks... I would not recommend attempting to take the old seal out as it is very difficult and you have a great possibility of breaking something that doesn't need to be broken. Just leave it in...
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: It's for a deep pan...
customer_reviews.text: Had to go to the store to get a shallow pan filter. (& that had a gasket as well all for less than half the price. Not happy)
customer_reviews.author: Pip Lache

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well and no leaks. Used on a 2003 Chevy Trailblazer EXT I6.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my 2004 GMC Envoy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my 2004 GMC Envoy. Bought a new pan with drain plug to make next fluid change easier.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Proper fit, Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: GM products are superior in quality. Fit correctly and provide excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: Educated Consumer

customer_reviews.title: The genuine AC delco part.
customer_reviews.text: This was the real deal AC Delco filter. I would highly recommend you don't swap in a no name filter. For as infrequent as you need to replace the trans filter it's not worth it to replace with an inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley James

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The gasket and filter was correct for my '08 chevy silverado 1500
customer_reviews.author: Greg Lott

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product was as advertised and the picture is exactly as pictured when it arrives. Keeping the gasket flat is key to a quick installation and it just makes it far easier than setting it in the sun for a few hours to get it to lay flat. I actually bought one a few years ago and the entire kit was in a small box and the gasket was folded up and it actually leaked after laying it in the sun to get it to lay flat. Hope this product stays on Amazon and they keep the packaging the same.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hyler

customer_reviews.title: Works. easy and OEM
customer_reviews.text: I used it on a 2007.5 Gmc Sierra 1500 and it fit perfect. No leaks or nada has happen. Oem product.
customer_reviews.author: Cristiano Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: AC Delco, enough said
customer_reviews.text: Do it right- OEM on a critical part that change infrequently
customer_reviews.author: Oman396

customer_reviews.title: A great factory replacement filter and gasket.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to beat OEM. A great factory replacement filter and gasket.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Rowley

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a good price.....
customer_reviews.text: I like to go with OEM parts when I can and if the price is not way out of line. From my experience OEM parts seem to fit better and are easier to install than a lot of aftermarket parts, although not all. This filter came with a better gasket than the Wix (a brand I trust) filter from my local auto parts. The price difference was a bit more but, for the better gasket it was worth it to me and Amazon had it for a good price. It was packaged very well from ACDelco. The gasket was sealed flat instead of folded in a box like a lot of others.
customer_reviews.author: ChromeBullet

customer_reviews.title: Not USA made.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy and packaged nicely. Made in Mexico. Shipped from Michigan.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Importance maintenance
customer_reviews.text: A lot of vehicles seem to get along ok without transmission service - modern transmissions are really quite remarkable. But if stressed often enough, they have to be serviced to keep them going. This filter and gasket worked fine on my 99 Silverado and hopefully will keep it running smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Part Time

customer_reviews.title: Solid parts for the money
customer_reviews.text: It’s a transmission gasket and filter. Change it every 30k and you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: ACDelco OEM filter fit as it should. Went in smoothly and my transmission has been shifting as good as new. A good bonus is the gasket is packaged flat so it makes the install much easier. I highly recommend the use of a secondary source to match the correct part numbers for your vehicle. Specifically one that specializes in only auto parts sales and can match your VIN with the correct parts. Then buy the parts on amazon to get it cheaper along with free super saver shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: Best quality, best price
customer_reviews.text: This fit perfectly on my 99 chevy silverado, it just popped right in. The old gasket was a pain to get off.
customer_reviews.author: Jakob B.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: S10 pan is difficult to remove and install but the kit worked fine
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: The Money you expend is worth it easy to DYS
customer_reviews.text: It fits perfectly my 2004 Chevy trailblazer Easy to install no complain with it
customer_reviews.author: gerardo

customer_reviews.title: works on chevy silverado 2002
customer_reviews.text: Did my own fluid change on my chevy silverado 2002 and worked like a charm
customer_reviews.author: Timbo K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit and no leaks. Everything worked out great for my 2007 Tahoe LT.
customer_reviews.author: Rey G.

customer_reviews.title: Not for 2014 Chevy Silverado
customer_reviews.text: This part did not fit my 2014 Chevy Silverado. The collector was entirely too short and the gasket was the wrong shape. I'm not sure it the issue was with this company or Amazon's tool for matching vehicles. Maybe it was user error. But, it did not help me in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Brixey

customer_reviews.title: fits my envoy or should fit your trailblazer
customer_reviews.text: fits my envoy or should fit your trailblazer all the parts to change your xmission gasket and filter!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When installing or removing old filter just be gentle because its plastic
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect for my 2000 gmc Sierra 4l60e deep pan tranny same exact part as oem. Good quality no leaking so far
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Good item for price
customer_reviews.text: Product was just as described perfect fit for my 2002 Tahoe
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2002 Silverado LS 4.8 with 4L60e trans
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 2002 Silverado LS 4.8 with 4L60e trans. Great factory replacement. Make sure you know if your truck is equipped with the deep pan or the standard pan. It makes a difference for what filter/kit you need to order.
customer_reviews.author: Giselle R.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, horrible packaging.
customer_reviews.text: The product was great but the way it was packaged was horrible,the box was ripped open leaving the opening of the inlet of the filter exposed to dirt or anything else that could get in the inlet and there was no seal with the filter so I had to use my old one but your product was the exact OEM fit.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart Paul

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this transmission fluid filter to go with a ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this transmission fluid filter to go with a new fluid pan I purchased (Dorman 265-811) It's designed for the deep pan configuration and is the correct fit for the aftermarket Dorman pan I purchased. Shipping was quick.
customer_reviews.author: Justin DeVoe

customer_reviews.title: Exact Fit, 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly, if you need help putting the gasket in straight, put a zip tie on each side of pan and leave some slack, and on the empty holes hand thread the bolts from pan into transmission. Take your time and don't rush, no need to break anything.
customer_reviews.author: Ritz

customer_reviews.title: Made in MEXICO
customer_reviews.text: I haven't installed this yet. Comes with the pan gasket and valve body round gasket. I am sure its going to work just fine, but it is not made in the USA. Made in Mexico. This is why half the USA is on government assistance.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES98WS6

customer_reviews.title: Genuine parts
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Excellent AC Delco quality part.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Klopp

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect direct fit for my 2003 Trailblazer. It was packaged well and filter slid right on.

customer_reviews.title: oem. it was very costly for my other chev ...
customer_reviews.text: oem. it was very costly for my other chev. truck , I ordered fram for less than half.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect part at the right price
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should, follow instructions, don't "bubba" the install and you'll be right as rain.
customer_reviews.author: steven Michael barefoot

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Did the job on my good ol reliable Chevy truck

customer_reviews.title: Original and best for your transmission.
customer_reviews.text: This filter kit fit my 2002 ZR2 4x4 Blazer perfectly. Excellent quality gasket and filter. Considering it's the transmission it protects, I wanted the best and I needed it to fit the first time, as I did the trans. Service in my carport.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and works great.
customer_reviews.text: '04 Chevy Trailblazer, deep pan, it's great to get the right parts that fit perfectly and work great! Thank you!

customer_reviews.text: Nothing in the photos came. I just got 1 filter that’s not even for my vehicle and does not look like the photo. On top of that I got no gasket either. So all I got was a filter that wasn’t even the right one. I’m pissed

customer_reviews.title: But seems like a nice oem replacement
customer_reviews.text: Haven't installed yet. But seems like a nice oem replacement.

customer_reviews.title: It was perfect for my 2000 chevy blazer 4wd
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect for my 2000 chevy blazer 4wd. Cut just right and has been working fine for 2 weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: For those in favor of OEM replacement components when servicing ...
customer_reviews.text: For those in favor of OEM replacement components when servicing their vehicle, I used this for my 2003 Chevrolet Silverado. Pricing was fair, shipping was fast. I service my trans every 35,000 miles and pan is clear of any contamination or residue.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Transmission
customer_reviews.text: I like using the AC Delco transmission filter. This isn't the time to go cheap. I wish GM had used the reusable gasket on these though

customer_reviews.text: The gasket seals tight and the filter fit. Can't ask for anything more

customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for a 2007 Chevy Silverado with a 4l60e transmission. Both the filter and the gasket are wrong the wrong ones. No idea what it's supposed to fit.

customer_reviews.text: Seems to be doing the job, have not had any issues in the few months it has been in the van.

customer_reviews.text: ACDELCO is a trusted brand for like OE parts. When this kit came in, It was perfect. I was able to get this kit on cyber Monday sale which made me even more happy.

customer_reviews.title: I installed this on my 2012 Chevrolet Colorado with a ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my 2012 Chevrolet Colorado with a deep pan. This worked well and there are no leaks. The only hard part of the installation was not making a mess and taking out the old filter seal.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit no issues 01 Tahoe 4wd
customer_reviews.text: It was well worth paying extra for AC Delco and at $33 it's cheap insurance against tranmission failure. Item fit perfectly and seal was just stiff enough that you could move the whole thing to line up the holes I couldn't quite reach while lying under the truck.

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance, thought it would fit on my 4L60E (16bolt fluid pan) transmission, turns out mine is a shallow pan. (1998 Chevrolet Truck C1500 1/2 ton P/U 2WD 5.7L)

customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly and the gasket works well. Did not come with the rubber grommet, but this is fine because the one in the transmission was in excellent shape.

customer_reviews.title: Genuine parts so the fit was great!

customer_reviews.text: Better price than the dealership when you can afford to wait, Factory OEM part, fit perfectly.

customer_reviews.title: It looks exactly like the one I took out from my transmission
customer_reviews.text: It looks exactly like the one I took out from my transmission. The old gasket was a real pain to clean from the pan though, and I don't even want to talk about this tiny filter retainer. Such a piss poor design.
customer_reviews.author: beniked

customer_reviews.title: Good quality GM original parts for Deep pan.
customer_reviews.text: Packaging kept the gasket nice and flat for a good fit on the pan. I have read about flow issues with other brand filters, so original parts seemed the safest route to me. This kit is for the deep pans which are identified by the step up in the bottome of the pan towards the rear.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M Warner

product_meta.title: ACDelco 24208576 Professional Automatic Transmission Fluid Filter Kit
product_meta.description: The Professional, premium aftermarket Automatic Transmission Filter Kit includes the materials to mount a transmission filter in place. This automatic transmission filter kit meets the performance standards you would expect from ACDelco.
feature_bullets: Provides the performance and dependability you expect from ACDelco
Manufactured to meet expectations for fit, form, and function
